titleStmt.title: Frances Sanders to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5514

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlett Govnor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

Your petitioner Francis Sanders would respectfully represent to your Excellency That at the present Term of the Grayson Circuit Court ^May 1864^ he was fined one hundred & thirty ^^ Dollars on an Indictment for Keeping a Disord^er^ally house, the facts proven was that your petitioner had taken to live with him a woman to whom he was not married and was seen sleeping with her on some 3 or 4 acasions, Your petitioner would further represent that he is a very poor man & cannot pay the fine he has no property out of which to make it or any part thereof & will be bound to be in the County Jail, if the law is enforsed as he Expects it will, & the length of time he would be compeld to by this would deprive him of making a crop & his little children ^would be deprived^ of many of the necessaries of life and of the Company & protection of an only parent ^who he has & sons of the Union army & are dead^ He prays your excellency to Interpose pose your Clemency and remit the Commonwealths part of said fine and would Ever pray as he is in duty bound to do

Frances ^his X Mark^ Sanders
